headline.main: College Funds Earn More Than Insurance Firms; Endowment Survey Shows Average 1940 Return Was 4.06 Per Cent

lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, May 31 -- College and university endowment funds as a class are earning a higher rate of income than the portfolios of life insurance companies, according to a study soon to be released by J. Harvey Cain, director of the Financial Advisory Service, American Council on Education.
